commentary: Mohammed Shami to KOA Powell, OUT taken at deep midwicket. Powell's good on the pull and he is forced to play that shot - Shami adjusting to the batsman stepping out of his crease and cramping the left-hander for room. Should Powell have gone through with an aggressive shot? The new ball is the best chance to score runs on this slow pitch so perhaps he can be given a little leeway. But at this level, and so early in the innings, you shouldn't be picking the deep fielders out. After all, in the first 10, there can be only two out there and if you're giving catching practice to them, then there's something seriously wrong
